instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hi guys.

I have the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, which was liquid damaged on different parts of the board but I managed to solve those issues. I got to a point where the KB is not working and I replaced a new one since that one was flooded. The power button works fine, but the rest of the kb is not. I get <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_KBD</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_4</SIGNAL>, and diode mode reading are good. 

Any suggestions, please?
Thanks :D

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Trackpad works good, only keyboard problem?
Check traces between J4801/10.
Try another trackpad flex.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: Yes trackpad works fine. I will take out the trackpad maybe some liquid went inside the flex cables and revert

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: Trackpad issue :D Solved and thank you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: Remember that KB information goes to PCH via TP...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: Yes got it :D Thank you very much
